body:
Most open-source AI tools fail the "5-minute test." If a developer can't get it running before their coffee cools down, they move on. 

This week, we merged 13 PRs focused entirely on removing the friction between "I want an agent" and "I have an agent working for me."

Here is what we shipped to fix the flow:

ðŸš€ 1. The "Brain" Upgrade (Web Search)
LLMs hallucinate. Grounded agents don't. We added Gemini + Search models and configured the `web_search` tool directly into OpenClaw. Your local agent can now browse the live web via Pollinations to fact-check itself. No complex API key juggling requiredâ€”it just works out of the box.

âš¡ 2. Zero-Friction Onboarding
We shipped a new setup script that handles the full stack:
- Auto-installs OpenClaw via npm if missing
- Writes the Pollinations config automatically
- Unified the "Connect" step into a single, clean UI

If you have to read a 10-page doc to run an open-source tool, it's not a toolâ€”it's a homework assignment. We killed the homework.

ðŸ”Œ 3. Ecosystem Expansion
We aren't building a silo. We added `n8n-nodes-pollinations` and `NebulaAPI` to our Dev Tools registry. Whether you're building low-code automation workflows or Minecraft integrations, the infrastructure is ready to plug and play.

Momentum is building. We are seeing more developers skip the "subscription fatigue" of closed providers and build on open, credit-based infrastructure where they own the pipes.

We are building the easiest way to use open-source AI. And we are doing it in public.
